title: Exploration of Field-Guided Assemblies of Magnetic Nanoparticles into Superstructures
summary: In this emerging line we focus on reconfigurable magnetic superstructures directed by dipolar interactions, tunable through particle size, morphology and surface chemistry.
descriptionHtml:
We study the template-free fabrication of reconfigurable superstructures from magnetic nanoparticles. Field-guided self-organization and dipolar coupling govern mesoscale order, enabling reversible transitions between architectures. The goal is to program magnetic response and topology without lithographic constraints.

By tuning size, shape and surface of the building blocks we access regimes where long-range interactions dominate, producing lattices and chains whose mechanical and magnetic properties can be modulated on demand. Preliminary findings outline design rules for robust, rewritable assemblies.
